gurmukhi: ÃÄ sRI vwihgurU jI kI Pqh ]
roman: ikOankaar sree vaahiguroo jee kee fateh ||
english: There is one god, Waheguroo, Victory is his.
Written by the Sovereign King, Guru Gobind Singh Ji
Speech of the poet.
Chaupai
Protect me O Lord! with Thine own Hands
all the desires of my heart be fulfilled.
Let my mind rest under Thy Feet
Sustain me, considering me Thine own.377.
Destroy, O Lord! all my enemies and
protect me with Thine won Hands.
May my family live in comfort
and ease alongwith all my servants and disciples.378.

gurmukhi: mo r`Cw inj kr dY kirXY ]
roman: mo ra'chhaa nij kar dhai kariyai ||
english: Protect me O Lord! with Thine own Hands
and destroy this day all my enemies
May all the aspirations be fulfilled
Let my thirst for Thy Name remain afresh.379.

gurmukhi: qumih Cwif koeI Avr n iDXwaUN ]
roman: tumeh chhaadd koiee avar na dhiyaauoo(n) ||
english: I may remember none else except Thee

gurmukhi: jo br choN su qum qy pwaUN ]
roman: jo bar chaho(n) su tum te paauoo(n) ||
english: And obtain all the required boons from Thee
Let my servants and disciples cross the world-ocean
All my enemies be singled out and killed.380.
Protect me O Lord! with Thine own Hands and
relieve me form the fear of death
May Thou ever Bestow Thy favours on my side
Protect me O Lord! Thou, the Supreme Destroyer.381.
Protect me, O Protector Lord!
Most dear, the Protector of the Saints:
Friend of poor and the Destroyer of the enemies

gurmukhi: qum ho purI cqur ds kMqw ]382]
roman: tum ho puree chatur dhas ka(n)taa ||382||
english: Thou art the Master of the fourteen worlds.382.
In due time Brahma appeared in physical form
In due time Shiva incarnated
In due time Vishnu manifested himself
All this is the play of the Temporal Lord.383.
The Temporal Lord, who created Shiva, the Yogi
Who created Brahma, the Master of the Vedas
The Temporal Lord who fashioned the entire world
I salute the same Lord.384.
The Temporal Lord, who created the whole world
Who created gods, demons and yakshas
He is the only one form the beginning to the end
I consider Him only my Guru.385.
I salute Him, non else, but Him
Who has created Himself and His subject
He bestows Divine virtues and happiness on His servants

gurmukhi: sq`Rün ko pl mo bD kIE ]386]
roman: sata'run ko pal mo badh keeo ||386||
english: He destroys the enemies instantly.386.

gurmukhi: Gt Gt ky AMqr kI jwnq ]
roman: ghaT ghaT ke a(n)tar kee jaanat ||
english: He knows the inner feelings of every heart
He knows the anguish of both good and bad
From the ant to the solid elephant

gurmukhi: sB pr ikRpw idRsit kr PUlw ]387]
roman: sabh par kirapaa dhirasaT kar foolaa ||387||
english: He casts His Graceful glance on all and feels pleased.387.
He is painful, when He sees His saints in grief
He is happy, when His saints are happy.
He knows the agony of everyone

gurmukhi: Gt Gt ky pt pt kI jwnYN ]388]
roman: ghaT ghaT ke paT paT kee jaanai(n) ||388||
english: He knows the innermost secrets of every heart.388.
When the Creator projected Himself,
His creation manifested itself in innumerable forms
When at any time He withdraws His creation,

gurmukhi: qum mY imlq dyh Dr sBhUM ]389]
roman: tum mai milat dheh dhar sabhahoo(n) ||389||
english: all the physical forms are merged in Him.389.
All the bodies of living beings created in the world
speak about Him according to their understanding
But Thou, O Lord! live quite apart from everything
this fact is know to the Vedas and the learned.390.
The Lord is Formless, Sinless and shelterless:
He is the Primal Power, without Blemish, without Beginning and Unborn
The fool claims boastfully about the knowledge of His secrets,

gurmukhi: jw ko Byv n pwvq bydw ]391]
roman: jaa ko bhev na paavat bedhaa ||391||
english: which even the Vedas do not know.391.
The fool considers Him a stone,

gurmukhi: mhw mUVH kCu Byd n jwnq ]
roman: mahaa mooRh kachh bhedh na jaanat ||
english: but the great fool does not know any secret
He calls Shiva “The Eternal Lord,
“but he does not know the secret of the Formless Lord.392.
According to ones won intellect,
one describes Thee differently
The limits of Thy creation cannot be known
and how the world was fashioned in the beginning?393.
He hath only one unparalleled Form
He manifests Himself as a poor man or a king at different places
He created creatures from eggs, wombs and perspiration
Then He created the vegetable kingdom.394.
Somewhere He sits joyfully as a king
Somewhere He contracts Himself as Shiva, the Yogi
All His creation unfolds wonderful things
He, the Primal Power, is from the beginning and Self-Existent.395.
O Lord! keep me now under Thy protection
Protect my disciples and destroy my enemies
All the villains creations outrage
and all the infidels be destroyed in the battlefield.396.
O Supreme Destroyer! those who sought Thy refuge,

gurmukhi: iqn ky duSt duiKq hÍY mry ]
roman: tin ke dhushaT dhukhit havai mare ||
english: their enemies met painful death
The persons who fell at Thy Feet,

gurmukhi: iqn ky qum sMkt sB twry ]397]
roman: tin ke tum sa(n)kaT sabh Taare ||397||
english: thou didst remove all their troubles.397.

gurmukhi: jo kil ko iek bwr iDAY hY ]
roman: jo kal ko ik baar dhiaai hai ||
english: Those who meditate even on the Supreme Destroyer,

gurmukhi: qw ky kwl inkit nih AYhY ]
roman: taa ke kaal nikaT neh aaihai ||
english: death cannot approach them.
They remain protected at all times
Their enemies and troubles come to and end instantly.398.
Upon whomsoever Thou dost cast Thy favourable glance,
they are absolved of sins instantly

gurmukhi: ir`iD is`iD Gr mo sB hoeI ]
roman: ri'dh si'dh ghar mo sabh hoiee ||
english: They have all the worldly and spiritual pleasures in their homes

gurmukhi: duSt Cwh CÍY skY n koeI ]399]
roman: dhushaT chhaeh chhavai sakai na koiee ||399||
english: None of their enemies can even touch their shadow.399.
He, who remembered Thee even once,
thou didst protect him from the noose of death
Those persons, who repeated Thy Name,
they were saved from poverty and attacks of enemies.400.
O Immortal Being (with the sword on Your banner)! I am under Your protection.
Give me Your hand and save me.
Stand by me everywhere,
and guard me against enmity and pain. 401.
The Mother of the world has been kind towards me
and I have completed the book this auspicious night
The Lord is the destroyer of all the sins of the body
and all the malicious and wicked persons.402.
When Mahakal became kind,
he immediately caused me to complete this book
He will obtain the fruit desired by the mind (who will read or listen to this book)
and no suffering will occur to him.403.
ARRIL

gurmukhi: sunY guMg jo Xwih su rsnw pwveI ]
roman: sunai gu(n)g jo yaeh su rasanaa paaviee ||
english: The dumb, who will listen to it, will be blessed with the tongue to speak

gurmukhi: sunY mUV icq lwie cqurqw AwveI ]
roman: sunai mooR chit lai chaturataa aaviee ||
english: The fool, who will listen to it attentively, will get wisdom

gurmukhi: dUK drd BO inkt n iqn nr ky rhY ]
roman: dhookh dharadh bhau nikaT na tin nar ke rahai ||
english: That person will be absolved of suffering, pain or fear,

gurmukhi: ho jo Xw kI eyk bwr cOpeI ko khY ]404]
roman: ho jo yaa kee ek baar chauapiee ko kahai ||404||
english: Who will even once recite this Chaupai-prayer.404.
CHAUPAI
ArD shs Puin qIin kihjY ]
bhaadhrav sudhee asaTamee rav vaaraa ||
It was Bikrami Samvat 1753

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI cirqR pKÎwny iqRXw cirqRy mMqRI BUp sMbwdy cwr sO pWc cirqR smwpq msqu suB msqu ]405]7558] APjMU ]
roman: eit sree charitr pakhayaane tirayaa charitre ma(n)tree bhoop sa(n)baadhe chaar sau paa(n)ch charitr samaapat masat subh masat ||405||7558|| afaja(n)oo ||
english: This book was completed on the banks of Sutlej on Sunday, the eighth Sudi of the month of Bhadon.
SWAYYA

gurmukhi: pwie ghy jb qy qumry qb qy koaU AWK qry nhI AwnXo ]
roman: pai gahe jab te tumare tab te kouoo aa(n)kh tare nahee aanayo ||
english: O God! the day when I caught hold of your feet, I do not bring anyone else under my sight

gurmukhi: rwm rhIm purwn kurwn Anyk khYN mq eyk n mwnXo ]
roman: raam raheem puraan kuraan anek kahai(n) mat ek na maanayo ||
english: None other is liked by me now the Puranas and the Quran try to know Thee by the names of Ram and Rahim and talk about you through several stories,

gurmukhi: isMimRiq swsqR byd sBY bhu Byd khY hm eyk n jwnXo ]
roman: si(n)mirat saasatr bedh sabhai bahu bhedh kahai ham ek na jaanayo ||
english: The Simritis, Shastras and Vedas describe several mysteries of yours, but I do not agree with any of them.

gurmukhi: sRI Aispwn ikRpw qumrI kir mY n khXo sB qoih bKwnXo ]863]
roman: sree asipaan kirapaa tumaree kar mai na kahayo sabh toh bakhaanayo ||863||
english: O sword-wielder God! This all has been described by Thy Grace, what power can I have to write all this?.863.
DOHRA

gurmukhi: sgl duAwr kau Cwif kY ghXo quhwro duAwr ]
roman: sagal dhuaar kau chhaadd kai gahayo tuhaaro dhuaar ||
english: O Lord! I have forsaken all other doors and have caught hold of only Thy door. O Lord! Thou has caught hold of my arm

gurmukhi: bwih ghy kI lwj Ais goibMd dws quhwr ]864]
roman: baeh gahe kee laaj as gobi(n)dh dhaas tuhaar ||864||
english: I, Govind, am Thy serf, kindly take (care of me and) protect my honour.864.
